intro: Schoenoplectiella brachyceras, commonly known as the narrow-headed spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant features slender, cylindrical stems that are often found in shallow water or moist soil. Its small, spike-like inflorescences consist of numerous tiny flowers, typical of the sedge family. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinct midrib, contributing to its overall appearance.
